summary:
The World Wide Web, or the Web, is like a huge library of information that anyone can access on the Internet. It was created by Tim Berners-Lee in 1989. Web pages are written in a language called HTML, which lets us see text, images, videos, and links to other pages.

We use web browsers like Google Chrome to view websites, which are collections of web pages. Websites have unique addresses called URLs. The Web has changed how we share and find information, making it easily accessible to people all over the world.
title: World Wide Web
